result.execSummary:
The defendant Ralph J. Noonan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge.   Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Report today for start date, with huber work, counseling and for child care if jail can properly monitor it.  Electric monitor if eligible can serve the last 60 days on home monitor.    Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ralph J. Noonan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:30 a.m. Defendant Ralph J Noonan in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases heard today: 14CF102, 14CF388, 15CF19, 14CF389, and 14CF390.   Amended Information filed in 14CF102 (amends count 1) and waived reading.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  Jail, consecutive each count (totaling 120 days) and costs for 14CF102 and 15CF19 Cts 1 & 2 and 4 uncharged read ins of 15PT237, 14PT2285, 15PT26 (bail jump) & 15P26 (Disorderly Conduct/domestic abuse).
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF102, 15CF19 ct 1 & 15CF19 ct 2 No contests 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF102, 15CF19 ct 1 & ct 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 14CF388, 15CF19 Ct 3, 14CF389, 14CF390 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Rushevics makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
14CF102 amended Ct 1: 30 days jail, report today for start date serve within 60 days, with huber work, counseling and for child care if jail can properly monitor it.  Electric monitor if eligible can serve the last 60 days on home monitor. Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
14CF102 Ct 2: Pay costs & DNA surcharge.

15CF19 ct 1: 45 days jail, consecutive to each other and 14CF102, report today for start date, with huber work, counseling and for child care if jail can properly monitor it.  Electric monitor if eligible can serve the last 60 days on home monitor. Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
15CF19 ct 2: 45 days jail, consecutive to each other and 14CF102, report today for start date, with huber work, counseling and for child care if jail can properly monitor it.  Electric monitor if eligible can serve the last 60 days on home monitor. Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
1 day jail credit
Status conference on July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ralph J. Noonan in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:00 AM Court calls case. 
Atty Knaapen states appearances. Atty Knaapen appears on behalf of Atty Constable.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court questions Attorney Rushevics.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State has filed information.

Atty Rushevics received a copy of the information and waives the reading.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalites.

Atty Rushevics enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Maris Rushevics in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:15 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
Attorney Rushevics makes statement to the court.  Spoke with defendant via phone but his car is not starting with charger.
Court asks for defendant to sign waiver and scheduled for arraign

binds the defendant over for trial. 

 Arraignment scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ralph J. Noonan in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Comply with all conditions as stated on any other bonds.
No overdoses of drugs.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

Clerk is Shelley 
1:26 p.m.  Court calls case.
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping-Felony, Contact after Domestic Abuse Arr.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Atty Rushevics is representing the defendant in this case and makes statements.
State requests a cash bond of $500.00 with conditions as stated.
Atty Rushevics makes additional statements regarding bond.
Defendant requests to make a statement and was informed to have his Attorney speak for him but makes a statement anyway.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   January 20, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1.
